intro: Campanula trachelium var. solitaria, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features basal leaves that are oval to lance-shaped. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
